clinical_study.brief_title: Erlotinib 100mg or 150mg in Treating EGFR Mutated NSCLC
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 3 Study of Erlotinib 100mg or 150mg in Treating EGFR Mutated Patients With Non-small Cell Lung Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether 100mg erlotinib had similar effect compared with 150mg erlotinib in NSCLC patients with EGFR mutation in China.

detailed_description.textblock: In China it was confirmed that 150mg Erlotinib was effective in NSCLC patients wtih EGFR mutation, but reducing dose occurring in some patients because of the drug related side-effects. Thus, we sought to investigate that in Chinese patients with EGFR mutation whether low dose (100mg) Erlotinib had similar efficacy but lower toxcities compared with standad dose (150mg) Erlotinib.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients will be followed for an expected average of 6 months
